Electricity.Description: Electricity can be generated by renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal power.
Electricity is distributed from power plants to consumers through a network of power lines and substations known as the power grid.
Electricity is used as a fuel to power electric vehicles, eliminating the need for gasoline or diesel.
Smart grids use advanced technologies to monitor and manage the flow of electricity, improving efficiency and reliability.
Gas turbines play a significant role in electricity generation, particularly in peaking power plants and combined cycle power plants.
